channel.title: Are there any good (new-ish) space pilot games?
channel.description: So I was at a friend's house yesterday and had a go on Halo Reach, and I really enjoyed the space level where you pilot the Longsword. This got me thinking, are there any decent flight-sim style games set in space? Preferably newer ones, so not Asteroids or X-Wing vs Tie-Fighter.

item.title: Are there any good (new-ish) space pilot games?
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Niathaur:

theres the X series. They are available from steam. AWESOME graphics and an evolving economy. You can actually have more than 1 ship and have them automatically trade(!). latest one is X3: Terran Conflict.

I was just playing this… looks cool, but there doesn’t seem to be much tutorial on how to fly the damn thing…
And I was flying around, following the arrows and stuff, and I was flying very close to a station of some kind… and then I wondered: what happens if I scratch my ship on it?

At the slightest bump, it pulled the camera outside the ship, and made my entire ship explode, with the words ‘GAME OVER’ on the screen… Seriously? :S

item.title: Are there any good (new-ish) space pilot games?
item.dc:creator: Texter
item.description:
Descent Freespace 2 has an open source mod community at Hard-light.net. They just keep on adding effects to what is still one of the best space combat sims out there. Think of big beam laser cannons on space cruisers and you being able to fire a flurry of wiggly missiles Anime style being part of the '99 game and all the lighting is now Dx9/10. They’re also working on a BSG mod there.
